title: Marginal Analysis Calculator
description: Interactive visualization for calculating and interpreting marginal cost, marginal revenue, and marginal profit for economic decision-making. Demonstrates how derivatives connect graphical tangent lines with numerical marginal values in business contexts.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Derivatives
Economics
Marginal Analysis
Optimization
learningObjectives: Calculate marginal cost, revenue, and profit from given functions
Interpret marginal values as slopes of tangent lines
Apply the MC = MR rule to find optimal production
Explain why profit maximization occurs when marginal profit equals zero
prerequisites: Understanding of derivatives as rates of change
Ability to find derivatives of polynomial functions
Basic cost, revenue, and profit concepts

controls.name: modeButton
controls.label: Display Mode
controls.description: Toggle between showing marginals, totals, or both

controls.name: findOptimalButton
controls.label: Find Optimal
controls.description: Animate to the profit-maximizing production level

assumptions: Quadratic cost function with positive leading coefficient
Revenue function reflects diminishing marginal revenue
limitations: Does not model discrete production constraints
Simplified economic model without market dynamics
